concise_definition: adj. 被调节的, 被控制的, 被缓和的; v. (过去式/过去分词) 调节, 控制, 缓和

definitions.explanation_en: Controlled or restrained to avoid extremes; kept within reasonable or acceptable limits, often to ensure fairness, balance, or stability.
definitions.explanation_cn: 被控制或约束以避免极端，保持在合理或可接受的范围内，通常为了确保公平、平衡或稳定。
definitions.example_en: The debate was moderated by a neutral host who ensured all sides had equal speaking time.
definitions.example_cn: 辩论由一位中立的主持人主持，确保各方都有平等的发言时间。

definitions.explanation_en: Characterized by a mild, reasonable, or temperate quality, especially in opinions, behavior, or conditions.
definitions.explanation_cn: 具有温和、合理或适中的特质，尤其用于描述观点、行为或状况。
definitions.example_en: She took a moderated approach to the controversial policy, avoiding both radical support and outright opposition.
definitions.example_cn: 她对这项有争议的政策采取了温和的态度，既不极端支持，也不完全反对。

definitions.explanation_en: To act as a neutral facilitator in a discussion, debate, or online forum, ensuring rules are followed and discourse remains respectful and orderly.
definitions.explanation_cn: 作为中立的协调者，在讨论、辩论或在线论坛中引导对话，确保规则被遵守，交流保持尊重和有序。
definitions.example_en: The forum moderator removed inappropriate comments and warned users who violated community guidelines.
definitions.example_cn: 论坛管理员删除了不当评论，并警告违反社区准则的用户。

definitions.explanation_en: To reduce the intensity, severity, or extremeness of something, often to make it more tolerable or manageable.
definitions.explanation_cn: 减轻某事物的强度、严重性或极端性，通常使其更易承受或管理。
definitions.example_en: The new policy was designed to moderate the impact of inflation on low-income families.
definitions.example_cn: 这项新政策旨在减轻通货膨胀对低收入家庭的影响。

comparison.analysis: “Controlled” (受控的) 强调通过外部力量或规则进行严格限制，常带有强制性，如控制温度、流量或行为。而 “moderated” 更侧重于通过平衡、调节来避免极端，通常隐含温和、理性与协商的意味，而非强制压制。
“Restraint” (克制) 指抑制冲动或情绪，强调自我控制，常用于个人行为或情感层面。而 “moderated” 更常用于系统性、结构性或第三方介入的调节过程，如会议主持、政策设计或平台管理。
“Mediated” (调解的) 指在冲突双方之间充当调解人，目的是促成协议或解决争端，强调双方互动与妥协。而 “moderated” 更侧重于维持秩序、规范流程，不一定涉及解决冲突，仅确保交流在规则内进行。
